means: 饮食有度的，有节制的，禁欲的

sentence.Network_en: Some people are able to remain sexually abstinent and thus escape all risks .
sentence.Network_cn: 一些人在性的方面能够坚持禁欲并且由此规避所有的风险。

sentence.Network_en: Indeed, very many females and males are neither abstinent nor sexually exclusive.
sentence.Network_cn: 真实的情形是, 非常多的男男女女既不禁欲也不性专一.

sentence.Network_en: During treatment, sexual activity should be abstinent.
sentence.Network_cn: 治疗期间, 宜节制房事.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : via Old French from Latin abstinent- 'abstaining', from the verb abstinere (see abstain)

means.word_mean: 1. a person who refrains from drinking intoxicating beverages
1. self-restraining; not indulging an appetite especially for food or drink;

auth_sentence.content: You may be abstinent, and for the sake of semantics, which you seem to put a high value on, you may be sober.

auth_sentence.content: Yet they cannot produce one verified example of migraine occurring in a person verified to be caffeine abstinent.

auth_sentence.content: Not the only means, but it is a solution that millions have tried and found success. To be sober is not to be simply abstinent.
